Sentencas: Aqueous dispersions of lanthanum strontium manganite (LSM) and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) particles were controllably freeze-cast and then partially sintered resulting in anisotropic, hierarchically porous ceramics for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) cathodes.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: The resulting microstructures have aligned pores with a characteristic spacing () between pore centers.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: The effect of freezing rate, slurry viscosity, and solid loading on solidification velocity and resultant microstructures was explored.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: Varying these parameters resulted in samples with a range of independently controllable and reproducible microstructures.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: Homogenous dispersion of LSM and YSZ in the freeze-cast structures was confirmed through elemental mapping.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: Freezing rate was found to have a significant effect on while solid loading affected overall porosity and ceramic wall- to-pore size ratio but had only a small influence on .
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites

Sentencas: Viscosity was found to have a complex albeit small impact on but a significant effect on particle dispersion and colloid stability.
Titulo: Processing of Hierarchical and Anisotropic Porosity LSM-YSZ Composites
